newsitem.title: ECUADOR: Ecuador's crude jumps to $18.76 per barrel.
newsitem.headline: Ecuador's crude jumps to $18.76 per barrel.

text.p: The reference price of Ecuador's crude jumped to an average of $18.76 per barrel on August 29, up from $18.38 the day before, a spokesman for state-run Petroecuador said Tuesday.
The price is tied to the Alaska North Slope (USG) price and Oman crude price, with different discounts payable in 30 days.
The average price in July was $17.46 per barrel, and $14.13 per barrel in July 1995.
Ecuador withdrew from the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries in December 1992.
